fields.name: location_ping_id
fields.description: Identifies the recorded vehicle location event.

fields.name: stop_sequence
fields.description: Ordered stop the vehicle is approaching or serving on a particular trip.

fields.name: device_id
fields.description: Identifies the device that recorded the vehicle location. May be null if only a single device is reporting vehicle location and the device_id is not distinct from vehicle_id.

fields.name: stop_id
fields.description: Identifies the stop the vehicle is approaching or serving currently.

fields.name: current_status
fields.description:
Indicates the status of the vehicle in reference to a stop. Valid options are:
0 - Incoming at.
1 - Stopped at.
2 - In transit to.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Degrees North, in the WGS-84 coordinate system.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Degrees East, in the WGS-84 coordinate system.

fields.name: gps_quality
fields.description:
Indicates the quality of data and communication provided by the GPS. Valid options are:
0 - Excellent.
1 - Good.
2 - Poor.

fields.name: bearing
fields.description: Bearing, in degrees, clockwise from true north, e.g., 0 would mean north and 90 would mean east. This can be the compass bearing, or the direction towards the next stop or intermediate location. This should not be deduced from the sequence of previous positions, which clients can compute from previous data.

fields.name: speed
fields.description: Momentary speed measured by the vehicle, in meters per second.

fields.name: schedule_deviation
fields.description: Indicates schedule adherence in seconds. A negative value represents an early vehicle. (An unscheduled trip would not have a scheduled deviation.)

fields.name: headway_deviation
fields.description: Indicates headway adherence in seconds. A negative value represents a shorter than scheduled headway.

fields.name: in_service
fields.description:
Indicates status of travel with regard to service. Valid options are:
0 - The vehicle is in passenger service.
1 - The vehicle is en-route to service.
2 - The vehicle is traveling from a service trip.
3 - The vehicle is on a layover.
4 - The vehicle is returning to a garage due to a suspension or breakdown.
5 - Travel for on-route replacement of breakdown.
6 - Other not in service

fields.name: schedule_relationship
fields.description:
Indicates the status of the stop. Valid options are:
0 - Scheduled.
1 - Skipped.
2 - Unscheduled.
3 - Canceled.
4 - Duplicated.
5 - Schedule modified.
